metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17795 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The function t2p_write_pdf in tiff2pdf.c in LibTIFF 4.0.9 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF file, a similar issue to CVE-2017-9935.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> addressed by same commit as CVE-2017-9935 we will not be fixing this issue in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4').
